content: Hi. I've been working on compiler issues lately. And I'm interested in prioritizing issues. Can I formally join the wg-prioritization? I would like to do it officially.

Hi @Takayuki Maeda thanks for showing interest in helping with issue prioritization! You can start by subscribing #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts or (if you prefer not too many notifications) just keep an eye there.

I have pinned a message about what we do (and how) here:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/How.20to.20help/near/241751050

And this is our page with a link to our procedures (and the metrics we try to use when assigning issues priorities)
https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/working-groups/prioritization/#how-can-i-get-involved

@apiraino
Thank you for your easy explanation! I subscribed #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alert :) Should I open a pull request in https://github.com/rust-lang/team ?

The PR on the team repository is optional and not necessary to do the work. But if you want to be enlisted, please go ahead and add me as reviewer
(I should be able to merge)
PR is merged :tada: @Takayuki Maeda
